intro: Pseudostellaria okamotoi f. palgongmolongiana, commonly known as the Palgongmolongian starwort, is a rare and specialized plant species belonging to the Caryophyllaceae family. It is characterized by its small, white or pale pink flowers and delicate, lance-shaped leaves. This subspecies is native to specific regions in Korea, where it thrives in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features include a low-growing habit and a preference for well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
